marketNews.title: Divestment Agreement for INCO Postponed to Next Week
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Kartika Wirjoatmodjo, stated that the divestment agreement for 14% of Vale Indonesia (INCO) shares to MIND ID will be signed on February 26, 2024, postponed from the initial planned schedule which was supposed to take place this week. Kartika mentioned that the shareholders have agreed on the transaction price. However, his side could not disclose the value amount as it is material public information. The divestment price for INCO shares to MIND ID is currently uncertain. On Friday (16/2), Kontan reported that the transaction price was 3,070 Rupiah per share. However, on Monday (19/2), IDN Financials reported that the divestment of INCO shares would be executed at a price of 3,750 Rupiah per share. After this divestment, MIND ID's share ownership in INCO will increase to 34%, making it the largest shareholder. Special Staff to the Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Arya Sinulingga, stated that the government will overhaul the board of commissioners and directors of INCO once the divestment is complete. Last week, INCO announced the resignation of 2 people from its board of commissioners. Key Takeaway As we have written in the previous Stockbit commentary, we predict that the INCO stock price movement has the potential to be volatile in line with the developments in the divestment process. On Friday (16/2), the INCO stock price weakened -7.75% following news of the divestment at a price of 3,070 Rupiah per share. However, on Monday (19/2), the INCO stock price rebounded +4.34% following news of a transaction price of 3,750 Rupiah per share. Although the divestment price for 14% of INCO shares has the potential to be lower than the market price, we assess that there is little chance the market price will drop to the same level. This is considering that this divestment is a prerequisite for INCO to obtain an extension of the IUPK concession, so it is reasonable for the government to obtain a lower price. In the long run, we see INCO's stock performance will be influenced by: 1) the movement of nickel selling prices which are currently under pressure, and 2) the development of nickel downstream projects that are currently under construction.

tickerNews.title: SIDO: Strong 4Q23 Performance; 2023 Net Profit Exceeds Target
tickerNews.content: PT Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul (SIDO) recorded net profit of 951 billion Rupiah (-13.9% YoY) in 2023, exceeding (108%) of consensus expectations. This result was supported by strong performance in 4Q23, with net profit of 364 billion Rupiah (+162.9% QoQ, -5.3% YoY). SIDO's performance in 4Q23 itself was driven by revenue recovery reaching 1.2 trillion Rupiah (+70% QoQ, -3.8% YoY). Margins also recovered significantly quarterly thanks to slower growth in Cost of Goods Sold (+43.1% QoQ) and operating expenses (+8.7% QoQ) compared to revenue.

tickerNews.title: ACES: January 2024 Same Store Sales Growth at +5.6% YoY, Meeting Management Target
tickerNews.content: Ace Hardware Indonesia (ACES) recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of +5.6% YoY in January 2024 (vs. Dec 2023: +11.6% YoY, Jan 2023: +2% YoY), in line with management targets, with an indicative sales value of 664 billion Rupiah. SSSG in January 2024 occurred across all regions, namely Jakarta (+3.8%), Java outside Jakarta (+5.9%), and outside Java (+6.1%). ACES opened 2 new stores in January 2024, namely ACE The Park Pejaten (Jakarta) covering 2,300 square meters and ACE Banyuwangi (Java outside Jakarta) covering 2,000 square meters. ACES management expects stronger SSSG growth in February 2024, driven by the Chinese New Year.

tickerNews.title: PTRO: Subsidiary KJP Becomes Controlling Shareholder After Acquiring 34% Stakes from Caraka Reksa Optima
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (PTRO/CUAN) announced that its subsidiary, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada (KJP), has completed the purchase of ~342.93 (34%) million shares of Petrosea from PT Caraka Reksa Optima. After this transaction, KJP will become the controller of PTRO. Based on previous information disclosure, KJP purchased 34% of PTRO shares for 940 billion Rupiah, implying a price of 2,741 Rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: AIMS Prepares Rights Issue in H1 2024 and Plans Capital Injection in RANS FC
tickerNews.content: Corporate Secretary of Akbar Indo Makmur Stimec (AIMS), Anton Hidayat, stated that the company is preparing a rights issue in the near future. Anton mentioned that AIMS will offer up to 20-30% new shares, expected to be completed by the end of 1H24. Going forward, AIMS plans to expand its business sector from energy to food and beverage, entertainment, sports, and media. Anton also said that AIMS is currently in the exploration stage for capital participation in a soccer club. Previously, AIMS signed an investment memorandum of understanding with RANS FC owned by Raffi Ahmad.

tickerNews.title: TAYS to Expand Marketing Reach in West Java, Targeting 100,000 Outlets in Two Years
tickerNews.content: President Director of Jaya Swarasa Agung (TAYS), Alexander Anwar, stated that the company will expand its marketing reach in the domestic market, starting with a focus on West Java. Alexander mentioned that sales in West Java in 2024 will grow 2-3 times, driven by the addition of distribution points and economic growth in the province. TAYS products are currently available in 30,000 outlets across Indonesia, and the company targets distribution points to reach 100,000 outlets in the next 2 years.

tickerNews.title: TikTok Still Violates Permendag 31/2023 by Integrating TikTok Shop with Social Media: Minister of Cooperatives and SMEs
tickerNews.content: Minister of Cooperatives and SMEs, Teten Masduki, stated that TikTok is still violating Ministerial Regulation on Trade Number 31 of 2023 which prohibits the practice of social commerce. Teten mentioned that in practice, TikTok still integrates TikTok Shop with social media. Teten said that his ministry has coordinated with the Ministry of Trade to follow up on these violations.

tickerNews.title: VinFast to Begin Building EV Factory in Indonesia This Year with $200 Million Investment
tickerNews.content: Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, stated that VinFast will start establishing an electric car factory in Indonesia in 2024. The factory is targeted to begin operating in 2026 with an investment value of 200 million US Dollars (3.1 trillion Rupiah). The factory will produce around 50 thousand units of vehicles per year, absorbing 1,000-3,000 workers. Locations planned for the factory are Batang, Central Java and Karawang, West Java.

tickerNews.title: PT Astra Honda Motor (AHM) Launches Honda SC e: Concept Electric Motorcycle at IIMS 2024
tickerNews.content: PT Astra Honda Motor (AHM) launched the Honda SC e: Concept electric motorcycle at the Indonesia International Motor Show (IIMS) 2024. This is AHM's third electric motorcycle product, after the Honda EM1 e: and EM1 e: Plus released at the end of 2023.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Plans to Sell Treasury Shares from Buyback
tickerNews.content: PTPP (PTPP) plans to sell treasury shares resulting from buyback totaling 14.56 million (0.2%) shares. The sale of these shares will be carried out by PT BNI Danareksa Sekuritas from March 8 to September 8, 2024.

tickerNews.title: Presidential Candidate Ganjar Invites Anies-Muhaimin Supporting Parties to Pursue Inquiry Right to Investigate Alleged Election Fraud
tickerNews.content: Presidential candidate number 3, Ganjar Pranowo, invited the supporting parties of Anies Baswedan-Muhaimin Iskandar to initiate an inquiry right or interpellation in the DPR to investigate the alleged fraud in the 2024 presidential election. Ganjar stated that he had proposed the idea of an inquiry right to his supporting parties in the DPR, such as PDIP and PPP. However, this proposal must receive support from other parties to meet the requirement of more than 50% of the council members.
